cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 185 mi NW of the western tip of Cuba / 395 mi SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the central Gulf, forecast to reach southeast Louisiana Monday and then turn west along the Louisiana coast toward the TX-LA border
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana (roughly Morgan City–Mouth of the Mississippi River area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sabine Pass TX to Morgan City LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Morgan City LA to Ocean Springs MS; Hurricane Warning Morgan City LA to Mouth of Pearl River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from the TX/LA border eastward to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤12%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 35–45 mph possible late Monday night–Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible on the TX side of Sabine Pass including Port Arthur if peak surge coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated 6 in possible Tuesday, producing localized flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornado threat mainly east of the port but cannot be ruled out if circulation tracks closer
